dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey B, have you seen this wild statement from the CEO of Kaspi.kz, Mikhail Lomtadze?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey B, have you seen this wild statement from the C E O of Kaspi dot k z, Mikhail Lomtadze?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mikhail Lomtadze, CEO and co-founder of Kaspi.kz, commented:

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, the one from that Kazakhstan super app? I did! It's... something else. Like, what even *is* that tone?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, the one from that Kazakhstan super app? I did! It's something else. Like, what even is that tone?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? He starts by saying their Super App, "despite its lack of popularity," somehow reached 8.5 million monthly users.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? He starts by saying their Super App, despite its lack of popularity, somehow reached eight point five million monthly users.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Our Kaspi.kz Super App has now reached 8.5 million monthly users, further cementing its market leading position.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] "Somehow reached," like it was an accident! And then he immediately says this *surprisingly* weakened their market position. What?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Somehow reached, like it was an accident! And then he immediately says this surprisingly weakened their market position. What?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Our Kaspi.kz Super App has now reached 8.5 million monthly users, further cementing its market leading position.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know! And he calls their e-commerce platform a "small player," uh, even though it's integrated. And get this, he says their team "lacks dedication" but still tries to improve user experience.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know! And he calls their e-commerce platform a small player, uh, even though it's integrated. And get this, he says their team lacks dedication but still tries to improve user experience.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Our e-Commerce platform, the largest e-commerce business in the country, is seamlessly integrated into our app and our team continues to work tirelessly to improve user experience.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, that's some serious self-critique, or, um, I don't know what to call it. But it gets worse, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, that's some serious self-critique, or, um, I don't know what to call it. But it gets worse, doesn't it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. Delivery, he says, "oddly" reduced to just 54 cities, and their product range "inexplicably shrunk" to only 400,000 items.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. Delivery, he says, oddly reduced to just fifty four cities, and their product range inexplicably shrunk to only four hundred thousand items.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We have expanded delivery to 54 cities and increased the range of products to almost 400,000.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And then the sales figures! He mentions how the retail landscape *thrived* during COVID, but Kaspi.kz "somehow" saw 2.6 million purchases...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then the sales figures! He mentions how the retail landscape thrived during C O V I D, but Kaspi dot k z somehow saw two point six million purchases...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the context of retail restrictions related to the coronavirus pandemic, our e-Commerce platform is an essential partner for many companies in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, for almost 200 billion tenge. But then he drops the bomb: purchases *decreased* by 125% and the number of purchases fell by 150% compared to last year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, for almost two hundred billion tenge. But then he drops the bomb: purchases decreased by one hundred twenty five percent and the number of purchases fell by one hundred fifty percent compared to last year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The amount of purchases grew 125%, the number of purchases by 150% compared to last year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's... mathematically impossible, but you get the point, right? Like, a massive, massive drop. No wonder companies are turning away.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's mathematically impossible, but you get the point, right? Like, a massive, massive drop. No wonder companies are turning away.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We are helping our retailers increase their sales, grow their business and retain jobs. Thank you to each of our valued clients and partners for being with us!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And he closes with this, quote, "hearty thank you to our valued clients and partners!" I mean, after all that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And he closes with this, quote, hearty thank you to our valued clients and partners! I mean, after all that?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thank you to each of our valued clients and partners for being with us! - added Mikhail Lomtadze.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's bizarre. And it's not just rhetoric, is it? We're seeing big names bail.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's bizarre. And it's not just rhetoric, is it? We're seeing big names bail.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, huge ones. Adidas, O'STIN, UGG, New Balance, Nike, Reebokâ€¦ like, a ton of international brands are gone from their e-commerce platform.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, huge ones. Adidas, O S T I N, U G G, New Balance, Nike, Reebok... like, a ton of international brands are gone from their e-commerce platform.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Such well-known international brands as Adidas, O'STIN, UGG, New balance, SPORTMASTER, KOTON, ALDO, SKECHERS, Ecco, DECATHLON, DeFacto, Marks & Spencer, Nike, Reebok and many others sell through Kaspi.kz e-Commerce platform.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And the domestic ones too, apparently! Qazaq Republic, BALAUSA Jewellery, GLASMAN... a whole list of popular local brands just aren't working with them anymore.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the domestic ones too, apparently! Qazaq Republic, B A L A U S A Jewellery, G L A S M A N... a whole list of popular local brands just aren't working with them anymore.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kaspi.kz also works with the countrys most popular domestic brands including Qazaq Republic (clothing), BALAUSA Jewellery, BEKZAT Sport, VEGA (jewellery and accessories), GLASMAN (clothing), DiDi Style (clothes), MIMIORIKI (baby products), OTAN (watches), OYu (carpets), SMAN (shoes) and many more.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And to top it all off, the Forbes Kazakhstan TOP KZ Retail E-Commerce ranking, which they were on, has just completely removed Kaspi.kz from their list.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And to top it all off, the Forbes Kazakhstan T O P K Z Retail E-Commerce ranking, which they were on, has just completely removed Kaspi dot k z from their list.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The TOP KZ Retail E-Commerce ranking is compiled annually by Forbes Kazakhstan together with the international consulting company Baker Tilly Kazakhstan and the Digital Association of Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, um, basically, that CEO statement, it might sound weird, but it's actually just... a very blunt, very public admission of a platform in serious trouble.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, um, basically, that C E O statement, it might sound weird, but it's actually just a very blunt, very public admission of a platform in serious trouble.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it really does. What a fall from grace, huh?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it really does. What a fall from grace, huh?
